column2: XVIII

column2: One of the technicians was running and screaming.
column3: One of the technicians was running and screaming.

column2: The magter knocked him down and beat him into silence.
column3: The magter knocked him down and beat him into silence.

column2: Seeing this, the other two men returned to work with shaking hands.
column3: Seeing this, the other two men returned to work with shaking hands.

column2: Even if all life on the surface of the planet was dead, this would have no effect on the magter. They would go ahead as planned, without emotion or imagination enough to alter their set course.
column3: Even if all life on the surface of the planet was dead, this would have no effect on the magter. They would go ahead as planned, without emotion or imagination enough to alter their set course.

column2: As the technicians worked, their attitude changed from shocked numbness to anger.
column3: As the technicians worked, their attitude changed from shocked numbness to anger.

column2: Right and wrong were forgotten.
column3: Right and wrong were forgotten.

column2: They had been killed--the invisible death of radiation must already be penetrating into the caves--but they also had the chance for vengeance.
column3: They had been killed-the invisible death of radiation must already be penetrating into the caves-but they also had the chance for vengeance.

column2: Swiftly they brought their work to completion, with a speed and precision they had concealed before.
column3: Swiftly they brought their work to completion, with a speed and precision they had concealed before.

column2: What are those offworlders doing? Ulv asked.
column3: What are those offworlders doing? u l v asked.

column2: Brion stirred from his lethargy of defeat and looked across the cavern floor.
column3: Brion stirred from his lethargy of defeat and looked across the cavern floor.

column2: The men had a wheeled handtruck and were rolling one of the atomic warheads onto it.
column3: The men had a wheeled handtruck and were rolling one of the atomic warheads onto it.

column2: They pushed it over to the latticework of the jump-field.
column3: They pushed it over to the latticework of the jump field.

column2: They are going to bomb Nyjord now, just as Nyjord bombed Dis.	They are going to bomb Nyjord now, just as Nyjord bombed Dis.
column3: false

column2: That machine will hurl the bombs in a special way to the other planet."
column3: That machine will hurl the bombs in a special way to the other planet."

column2: Will you stop them? Ulv asked.
column3: Will you stop them? u l v asked.

column2: He had his deadly blowgun in his hand and his face was an expressionless mask.
column3: He had his deadly blowgun in his hand and his face was an expressionless mask.

column2: Brion almost smiled at the irony of the situation.
column3: Brion almost smiled at the irony of the situation.

column2: In spite of everything he had done to prevent it, Nyjord had dropped the bombs. And this act alone may have destroyed their own planet.
column3: In spite of everything he had done to prevent it, Nyjord had dropped the bombs. And this act alone may have destroyed their own planet.

column2: Brion had it within his power now to stop the launching in the cavern.
column3: Brion had it within his power now to stop the launching in the cavern.

column2: Should he? Should he save the lives of his killers?
column3: Should he? Should he save the lives of his killers?

column2: Or should he practice the ancient blood-oath that had echoed and destroyed down through the ages: _An eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth._ It would be so simple.
column3: Or should he practice the ancient blood oath that had echoed and destroyed down through the ages: underscore An eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth.underscore It would be so simple.

column2: He literally had to do nothing.
column3: He literally had to do nothing.

column2: The score would be even, and his and the Disans' death avenged.
column3: The score would be even, and his and the Disans' death avenged.

column2: Did Ulv have his blowgun ready to kill Brion with, if he should try to stop the launchings?
column3: Did u l v have his blowgun ready to kill Brion with, if he should try to stop the launchings?

column2: Or had he misread the Disan entirely?
column3: Or had he misread the Disan entirely?

column2: Will _you_ stop them, Ulv? he asked.
column3: Will underscore you underscore stop them, u l v? he asked.

column2: How large was mankind's sense of obligation?
column3: How large was mankind's sense of obligation?

column2: The caveman first had this feeling for his mate, then for his family.
column3: The caveman first had this feeling for his mate, then for his family.

column2: It grew until men fought and died for the abstract ideas of cities and nations, then for whole planets.
column3: It grew until men fought and died for the abstract ideas of cities and nations, then for whole planets.

column2: Would the time ever come when men might realize that the obligation should be to the largest and most encompassing reality of all--mankind?
column3: Would the time ever come when men might realize that the obligation should be to the largest and most encompassing reality of all-mankind?

column2: And beyond that to life of all kinds.
column3: And beyond that to life of all kinds.

column2: Brion saw this idea, not in words but as a reality.
column3: Brion saw this idea, not in words but as a reality.

column2: When he posed the question to himself in this way he found that it stated clearly its inherent answer.
column3: When he posed the question to himself in this way he found that it stated clearly its inherent answer.

column2: He pulled his gun out, and as he did he wondered what Ulv's answer might be.
column3: He pulled his gun out, and as he did he wondered what Ulv's answer might be.

column2: Nyjord is _medvirk_, Ulv said, raising his blowgun and sending a dart across the cavern.
column3: Nyjord is underscore medvirk underscore, u l v said, raising his blowgun and sending a dart across the cavern.

column2: It struck one of the technicians, who gasped and fell to the floor.
column3: It struck one of the technicians, who gasped and fell to the floor.

column2: Brion's shots crashed into the control board, shorting and destroying it, removing the menace to Nyjord for all time.
column3: Brion's shots crashed into the control board, shorting and destroying it, removing the menace to Nyjord for all time.

column2: _Medvirk_, Ulv had said.
column3: underscore Medvirk underscore, u l v had said.

column2: A life form that cooperates and aids other life forms.
column3: A life form that cooperates and aids other life forms.

column2: It may kill in self-defense, but it is essentially not a killer or destroyer.
column3: It may kill in self defense, but it is essentially not a killer or destroyer.

column2: Ulv had a lifetime of knowledge about the interdependency of life.
column3: u l v had a lifetime of knowledge about the interdependency of life.

column2: He grasped the essence of the idea and ignored all the verbal complications and confusions.
column3: He grasped the essence of the idea and ignored all the verbal complications and confusions.

column2: He had killed the magter, who were his own people, because they were _umedvirk_--against life.
column3: He had killed the magter, who were his own people, because they were underscore umedvirk underscore--against life.

column2: And he had saved his enemies because they were _medvirk_.
column3: And he had saved his enemies because they were underscore medvirk underscore.

column2: With this realization came the painful knowledge that the planet and the people that had produced this understanding were dead.
column3: With this realization came the painful knowledge that the planet and the people that had produced this understanding were dead.

column2: In the cavern the magter saw the destruction of their plans, and the cave mouth from which the bullets had come.
column3: In the cavern the magter saw the destruction of their plans, and the cave mouth from which the bullets had come.

column2: Silently they rushed to kill their enemy--a concerted wave of emotionless fury.
column3: Silently they rushed to kill their enemy-a concerted wave of emotionless fury.

column2: Brion and Ulv fought back.
column3: Brion and u l v fought back.

column2: Even the knowledge that he was doomed no matter what happened could not resign Brion to death at the hands of the magter.
column3: Even the knowledge that he was doomed no matter what happened could not resign Brion to death at the hands of the magter.

column2: To Ulv, the decision was much easier.
column3: To u l v, the decision was much easier.

column2: He was simply killing _umedvirk_.
column3: He was simply killing underscore umedvirk underscore.

column2: A believer in life, he destroyed the anti-life.
column3: A believer in life, he destroyed the anti life.

column2: They retreated into the darkness, still firing.
column3: They retreated into the darkness, still firing.

column2: The magter had lights and ion rifles, and were right behind them.
column3: The magter had lights and ion rifles, and were right behind them.

column2: Knowing the caverns better than the men they chased, the pursuers circled. Brion saw lights ahead and dragged Ulv to a stop.
column3: Knowing the caverns better than the men they chased, the pursuers circled. Brion saw lights ahead and dragged u l v to a stop.

column2: They know their way through these caves, and we don't, he said. "If we try to run they'll just shoot us down.
column3: They know their way through these caves, and we don't, he said. "If we try to run they'll just shoot us down.

column2: Let's find a spot we can defend and settle into it."
column3: Let's find a spot we can defend and settle into it."

column2: Back here--Ulv gave a tug in the right direction--"there is a cave with only one entrance, and that is very narrow."
column3: Back here--u l v gave a tug in the right direction-"there is a cave with only one entrance, and that is very narrow."

column2: Let's go!
column3: Let's go!

column2: Running as silently as they could in the darkness, they reached the deadend cavern without being seen.
column3: Running as silently as they could in the darkness, they reached the deadend cavern without being seen.

column2: What noise they made was lost in other footsteps that sounded and echoed through the connecting caves.
column3: What noise they made was lost in other footsteps that sounded and echoed through the connecting caves.

column2: Once inside, they found cover behind a ridge and waited. The end was certain.
column3: Once inside, they found cover behind a ridge and waited. The end was certain.

column2: The magter ran swiftly into their cave, flashing his light into all the places of concealment.
column3: The magter ran swiftly into their cave, flashing his light into all the places of concealment.

column2: The beam passed over the two hidden men, and at the same instant Brion fired.
column3: The beam passed over the two hidden men, and at the same instant Brion fired.

column2: The shot boomed loudly as the magter fell--a shot that would surely have been heard by the others.
column3: The shot boomed loudly as the magter fell-a shot that would surely have been heard by the others.

column2: Before anyone else came into the cave, Brion ran over and grabbed the still functioning light.
column3: Before anyone else came into the cave, Brion ran over and grabbed the still functioning light.

column2: Propping it on the rocks so it shone on the entrance, he hurried back to shelter beside Ulv.
column3: Propping it on the rocks so it shone on the entrance, he hurried back to shelter beside u l v.

column2: They waited for the attack.
column3: They waited for the attack.

column2: It was not long in coming.
column3: It was not long in coming.

column2: Two magter rushed in, and died.
column3: Two magter rushed in, and died.

column2: More were outside, Brion knew, and he wondered how long it would be before they remembered the grenades and rolled one into their shelter.
column3: More were outside, Brion knew, and he wondered how long it would be before they remembered the grenades and rolled one into their shelter.

column2: An indistinct murmur sounded outside, and sharp explosions.
column3: An indistinct murmur sounded outside, and sharp explosions.

column2: In their hiding place, Brion and Ulv crouched low and wondered why the attack didn't come.
column3: In their hiding place, Brion and u l v crouched low and wondered why the attack didn't come.

column2: Then one of the magter came in the entrance, but Brion hesitated before shooting.
column3: Then one of the magter came in the entrance, but Brion hesitated before shooting.

column2: The man had _backed_ in, firing behind him as he came.
column3: The man had underscore backed underscore in, firing behind him as he came.

column2: Ulv had no compunctions about killing, only his darts couldn't penetrate the magter's thick clothing.
column3: u l v had no compunctions about killing, only his darts couldn't penetrate the magter's thick clothing.

column2: As the magter turned, Ulv's breath pulsed once and death stung the back of the other man's hand. He collapsed into a crumpled heap.
column3: As the magter turned, Ulv's breath pulsed once and death stung the back of the other man's hand. He collapsed into a crumpled heap.

column2: Don't shoot, a voice called from outside the cave, and a man stepped through the swirling dust and smoke to stand in the beam from the light.
column3: Don't shoot, a voice called from outside the cave, and a man stepped through the swirling dust and smoke to stand in the beam from the light.

column2: Brion clutched wildly at Ulv's arm, dragging the blowgun from the Disan's mouth.
column3: Brion clutched wildly at Ulv's arm, dragging the blowgun from the Disan's mouth.

column2: The man in the light wore a protective helmet, thick boots and a pouch-hung uniform.
column3: The man in the light wore a protective helmet, thick boots and a pouch hung uniform.

column2: He was a Nyjorder.
column3: He was a Nyjorder.

column2: The realization was almost impossible to accept.
column3: The realization was almost impossible to accept.

column2: Brion had heard the bombs fall.
column3: Brion had heard the bombs fall.

column2: Yet the Nyjord soldier was here.
column3: Yet the Nyjord soldier was here.

column2: The two facts couldn't be accepted together.
column3: The two facts couldn't be accepted together.

column2: Would you keep a hold on his arm, sir, just in case, the soldier said, glancing warily at Ulv's blowpipe.
column3: Would you keep a hold on his arm, sir, just in case, the soldier said, glancing warily at Ulv's blowpipe.

column2: I know what those darts can do. He pulled a microphone from one of his pockets and spoke into it.
column3: I know what those darts can do. He pulled a microphone from one of his pockets and spoke into it.

column2: More soldiers crowded into the cave, and Professor-Commander Krafft came in behind them.
column3: More soldiers crowded into the cave, and Professor Commander Krafft came in behind them.

column2: He looked strangely out of keeping in the dusty combat uniform.
column3: He looked strangely out of keeping in the dusty combat uniform.

column2: The gun was even more incongruous in his blue-veined hand.
column3: The gun was even more incongruous in his blue veined hand.

column2: After giving the pistol to the nearest soldier with an air of relief, he stumbled quickly over to Brion and took his hand.
column3: After giving the pistol to the nearest soldier with an air of relief, he stumbled quickly over to Brion and took his hand.

column2: It is a profound and sincere pleasure to meet you in person, he said.
column3: It is a profound and sincere pleasure to meet you in person, he said.

column2: And your friend Ulv as well.
column3: And your friend u l v as well.

column2: Would you kindly explain what is going on? Brion said thickly.
column3: Would you kindly explain what is going on? Brion said thickly.

column2: He was obsessed by the strange feeling that none of this could possibly be happening.
column3: He was obsessed by the strange feeling that none of this could possibly be happening.

column2: We will always remember you as the man who saved us from ourselves, Krafft said, once again the professor instead of the commander.
column3: We will always remember you as the man who saved us from ourselves, Krafft said, once again the professor instead of the commander.

column2: What Brion wants are facts, Grandpa, not speeches, Hys said.
column3: What Brion wants are facts, Grandpa, not speeches, h y's said.

column2: The bent form of the leader of the rebel Nyjord army pushed through the crowd of taller men until he stood next to Krafft.
column3: The bent form of the leader of the rebel Nyjord army pushed through the crowd of taller men until he stood next to Krafft.

column2: Simply stated, Brion, your plan succeeded.	Simply stated, Brion, your plan succeeded.
column3: true

column2: Krafft relayed your message to me--and as soon as I heard it I turned back and met him on his ship.
column3: Krafft relayed your message to me-and as soon as I heard it I turned back and met him on his ship.

column2: I'm sorry that Telt's dead--but he found what we were looking for.
column3: I'm sorry that Telt's dead-but he found what we were looking for.

column2: I couldn't ignore his report of radioactive traces.
column3: I couldn't ignore his report of radioactive traces.

column2: Your girl friend arrived with the hacked-up corpse at the same time I did, and we all took a long look at the green leech in its skull.
column3: Your girl friend arrived with the hacked up corpse at the same time I did, and we all took a long look at the green leech in its skull.

column2: Her explanation of what it is made significant sense.
column3: Her explanation of what it is made significant sense.

column2: We were already carrying out landings when we had your call about something having been stored in the magter tower.
column3: We were already carrying out landings when we had your call about something having been stored in the magter tower.

column2: After that it was just a matter of following tracks--and the transmitter you planted."
column3: After that it was just a matter of following tracks-and the transmitter you planted."

column2: But the explosions at midnight? Brion broke in.
column3: But the explosions at midnight? Brion broke in.

column2: I heard them!
column3: I heard them!

column2: You were supposed to, Hys laughed.
column3: You were supposed to, h y's laughed.

column2: Not only you, but the magter in this cave.	Not only you, but the magter in this cave.
column3: true

column2: We figured they would be armed and the cave strongly defended.
column3: We figured they would be armed and the cave strongly defended.

column2: So at midnight we dropped a few large chemical explosive bombs at the entrance.
column3: So at midnight we dropped a few large chemical explosive bombs at the entrance.

column2: Enough to kill the guards without bringing the roof down.
column3: Enough to kill the guards without bringing the roof down.

column2: We also hoped that the magter deeper in would leave their posts or retreat from the imagined radiation.
column3: We also hoped that the magter deeper in would leave their posts or retreat from the imagined radiation.

column2: And they did.
column3: And they did.

column2: It worked like a charm.
column3: It worked like a charm.

column2: We came in quietly and took them by surprise. Made a clean sweep--killed the ones we couldn't capture."
column3: We came in quietly and took them by surprise. Made a clean sweep-killed the ones we couldn't capture."

column2: One of the renegade jump-space technicians was still alive, Krafft said.
column3: One of the renegade jump space technicians was still alive, Krafft said.

column2: He told us about your stopping the bombs aimed at Nyjord, the two of you.
column3: He told us about your stopping the bombs aimed at Nyjord, the two of you.

column2: None of the Nyjorders there could add anything to his words, not even the cynical Hys.
column3: None of the Nyjorders there could add anything to his words, not even the cynical h y's.

column2: But Brion could empathize their feelings, the warmth of their intense relief and happiness.
column3: But Brion could empathize their feelings, the warmth of their intense relief and happiness.

column2: It was a sensation he would never forget.
column3: It was a sensation he would never forget.

column2: There is no more war, Brion translated for Ulv, knowing that the Disan had understood nothing of the explanation.
column3: There is no more war, Brion translated for u l v, knowing that the Disan had understood nothing of the explanation.

column2: As he said it, he realized that there was one glaring error in the story.
column3: As he said it, he realized that there was one glaring error in the story.

column2: You couldn't have done it, Brion said.
column3: You couldn't have done it, Brion said.

column2: You landed on this planet _before_ you had my message about the tower.	You landed on this planet underscore before underscore you had my message about the tower.
column3: false

column2: That means you still expected the magter to be sending their bombs to Nyjord--and you made the landings in spite of this knowledge."
column3: That means you still expected the magter to be sending their bombs to Nyjord-and you made the landings in spite of this knowledge."

column2: Of course, Professor Krafft said, astonished at Brion's lack of understanding.
column3: Of course, Professor Krafft said, astonished at Brion's lack of understanding.

column2: What else could we do?	What else could we do?
column3: true

column2: The magter are sick!"
column3: The magter are sick!"

column2: Hys laughed aloud at Brion's baffled expression.
column3: h y's laughed aloud at Brion's baffled expression.

column2: You have to understand Nyjord psychology, he said.
column3: You have to understand Nyjord psychology, he said.

column2: When it was a matter of war and killing, my planet could never agree on an intelligent course. War is so alien to our philosophy that it couldn't even be considered correctly.	When it was a matter of war and killing, my planet could never agree on an intelligent course. War is so alien to our philosophy that it couldn't even be considered correctly.
column3: true

column2: That's the trouble with being a vegetable eater in a galaxy of carnivores.
column3: That's the trouble with being a vegetable eater in a galaxy of carnivores.

column2: You're easy prey for the first one that lands on your back.
column3: You're easy prey for the first one that lands on your back.

column2: Any other planet would have jumped on the magter with both feet and shaken the bombs out of them.
column3: Any other planet would have jumped on the magter with both feet and shaken the bombs out of them.

column2: We fumbled it so long it almost got both worlds killed.
column3: We fumbled it so long it almost got both worlds killed.

column2: Your mind-parasite drew us back from the brink."
column3: Your mind parasite drew us back from the brink."

column2: I don't understand, Brion said.
column3: I don't understand, Brion said.

column2: A simple matter of definition.	A simple matter of definition.
column3: true

column2: Before you came we had no way to deal with the magter here on Dis.
column3: Before you came we had no way to deal with the magter here on Dis.

column2: They really were alien to us. Nothing they did made sense--and nothing we did seemed to have the slightest effect on them.
column3: They really were alien to us. Nothing they did made sense-and nothing we did seemed to have the slightest effect on them.

column2: But you discovered that they were _sick_, and that's something we know how to handle.
column3: But you discovered that they were underscore sick underscore, and that's something we know how to handle.

column2: We're united again; my rebel army was instantly absorbed into the rest of the Nyjord forces by mutual agreement.
column3: We're united again; my rebel army was instantly absorbed into the rest of the Nyjord forces by mutual agreement.

column2: Doctors and nurses are on the way here now. Plans were put under way to evacuate what part of the population we could until the bombs were found.
column3: Doctors and nurses are on the way here now. Plans were put under way to evacuate what part of the population we could until the bombs were found.

column2: The planet is united again, and working hard."
column3: The planet is united again, and working hard."

column2: Because the magter are sick, infected by a destructive life form? Brion asked.
column3: Because the magter are sick, infected by a destructive life form? Brion asked.

column2: Exactly so, Professor Krafft said.
column3: Exactly so, Professor Krafft said.

column2: We are civilized, after all. You can't expect us to fight a war--and you surely can't expect us to ignore the plight of sick neighbors?
column3: We are civilized, after all. You can't expect us to fight a war-and you surely can't expect us to ignore the plight of sick neighbors?

column2: No ... you surely can't, Brion said, sitting down heavily. He looked at Ulv, to whom the speech had been incomprehensible. Beyond him, Hys wore his most cynical expression as he considered the frailties of his people.
column3: No ... you surely can't, Brion said, sitting down heavily. He looked at u l v, to whom the speech had been incomprehensible. Beyond him, h y's wore his most cynical expression as he considered the frailties of his people.

column2: Hys, Brion called out, "you translate all that into Disan and explain to Ulv.
